content.description: An ideal gas may be taken from one state to another state with a different pressure, volume, and temperature along several different paths. Quantities that will always be the same for this process, regardless of which path is taken, include which of the following?
content.question: I. The change in internal energy of the gasII. The heat exchanged between the gas and its surroundingsIII. The work done by the gas

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
